ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Selo's Song of Travel
ygData.msgSnippet: I m done arguing this thread.  Kabong, it s way off topic anyway He made a mistake.  Which he corrected and admitted to.  Like I said, if you can do the job
ygData.messageBody:
I'm done arguing this thread. Kabong, it's way off topic anyway
He made a mistake. Which he corrected and admitted to. Like I said, if you
can do the job better, go apply.

Lyrnia
----- Original Message -----
From: "Gordon Hughes" <ghughes@...>
To: <eqbards@egroups.com>
Sent: Thursday, June 01, 2000 8:39 AM
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Selo's Song of Travel


> Lyrnia,
>
> I don't doubt that he's a nice guy and knows his own class inside out and
I
> have a lot of respect for him for putting up with the flak from
disgruntled
> players daily.
>
> However, I'm with Galtin on this one. Before tossing some ideas into the
> lion's den, he should have checked with the spell gurus or at least
someone
> in-house that plays a Bard. It sounds like he even spoke with GZ about it.
>
> If he did check, it's safe to assume the spell guys don't know how some
Bard
> songs interact with each other and/or they don't have a Bard of sufficient
> level in-house to verify that twisting Invis with anything else doesn't
> work.
>
> -KS
>
>
